course_title: Special Topics: American Studies: Asian American Drama
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 3 / Seats Avail: 3Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as THEA 366W 1, EAS 385W 2, ENG 366W 1)
COURSE DESCRIPTION: This course introduces selected contemporary theater works since 1950, centering Asian American artists in theater history, theory, and criticism. Topics include orientalism, Miss Saigon controversy, yellowface, Asian American feminism, Afro-Asian entanglements, the 2021 Atlanta spa shootings, among others. For more information, contact Dr. Jieun Lee via jieun.lee.theater@emory.edu.
course_description: Specialized courses in American culture and history. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
